name: ManicSymptomAssessment
title: Manic Symptom Assessment
description: Assessment of the person's manic symptoms (Business ID: Entry 611476)
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of values addresses terms representing Manic Symptom Assessment.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this set of values is to identify patients who have a/an assessment of the person's manic symptoms.),(Inclusion Criteria: Includes LOINC codes for Manic Symptom Assessment.),(Exclusion Criteria: Terms not representative of observable encoded terms that may have values indicating Manic Symptom Assessment.)

contains.display: PhenX - hypomania - mania symptoms - child protocol 120401
PhenX - hypomania - mania symptoms - adult protocol 120402
Has your child experienced periods of several days or more when he or she was unable to sit still, and had to keep moving or jumping from one activity to another [P-GBI]
Have there been periods of several days or more when your childs friends or other family members told you that your child seemed unusually happy or high [P-GBI]
Has your childs mood or energy shifted rapidly back and forth from happy to sad or high to low [P-GBI]
Has your child had periods of extreme happiness and intense energy lasting several days or more when he or she also felt much more anxious [P-GBI]
Have there been times of several days or more when, although your child was feeling unusually happy and intensely energetic, he or she also had to struggle very hard to control rage [P-GBI]
Has your child had periods of extreme happiness and intense energy, when it took him or her over an hour to get to sleep at night [P-GBI]
Have you found that your childs feelings or energy are generally up or down, but rarely in the middle [P-GBI]

Has your child had periods lasting several days or more when he or she felt depressed or irritable, and then other periods when he or she felt extremely high, elated, and overflowing with energy [P-GBI]
Have there been periods when, although your child was feeling unusually happy and intensely energetic, almost everything got on his or her nerves and made him or her irritable or angry [P-GBI]
How are you feeling today compared to your usual state [HCL-32]
Compared to other people my level of activity, energy and mood [HCL-32]
How did people close to you react to or comment on your highs [HCL-32]
Length of your highs as a rule, on the average [HCL-32]
Have you experienced such highs in the past 12 months [HCL-32]
If yes, please estimate how many day you spent in highs during the last 12 months [HCL-32]
Aspects of your life [HCL-32]
Impact of your highs on this aspect of your life [HCL-32]
High state behavior or feelings [HCL-32]
In a high state I have this behavior or feeling [HCL-32]
Hypomanic or manic symptom notes [Text] [DI-PAD]
